Notes: Schools reopened in September, but schedules have been modified. Classes are now shorter (30-45 min) and larger classes have been split into two sessions.   Teachers at pre-university education level are required to be either vaccinated or show a weekly Covid test certificate  Lecturers and university students are required to be either vaccinated or show a weekly Covid test certificate  Social distancing measures, emphasis on hygiene, and mask-wearing  School year started 2 weeks earlier to allow for repetition of classes for missed content   âVia a video message on Sunday, Minister of Education, Sports and Youth Evis Kushi wished all students and teachers a new successful school year and urged everyone "to respect anti-COVID measures as health is the most important element in these pandemic times."â    Sources:  https://web.archive.org/web/20211113141838/http://www.news.cn/english/europe/2021-09/28/c_1310214789.htm

Nationwide measures  From week 38, the Corona Commission will determine the epidemiological risk for the educational institutions per federal state. On the basis of this classification, the Education Directorate determines the risk level for the federal state in agreement with the central office by ordinance. The responsible education directorate then informs the schools. Defined framework conditions also enable flexible measures to be taken at the school location.    Corona traffic light map  On November 4th, 2021, the Corona Commission classifies all of Austria and all federal states as a very high risk. The classification for the education sector is risk level II for all federal states.     Sources:  https://archive.vn/qUpEP - Corona traffic light map  https://archive.vn/J7wJi - Nationwide Measures  https://archive.vn/ouA5Z - Current Measures

On November 11th, 2021, the Corona Commission classifies all of Austria and all federal states as a very high risk.     The classification for the education sector is risk level III for Lower Austria, Upper Austria and Tyrol and risk level II for all other federal states.     Source: https://archive.vn/Krw7v#selection-541.0-549.153

Nationwide measures  "From week 38, the Corona Commission will determine the epidemiological risk for the educational institutions per federal state. On the basis of this classification, the Education Directorate determines the risk level for the federal state in agreement with the central office by ordinance. The responsible education directorate then informs the schools. Defined framework conditions also enable flexible measures to be taken at the school location." The classification for the education sector is risk level III."    Sources:  https://archive.vn/kqgPP#selection-2225.0-2237.94 [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/fnc25 [Corona traffic light map]

Educational area  Meetings for training and further education purposes may only take place for people from the same household. Otherwise, training and further training may only take place for as many people as is necessary.    The schools are open to all who need them. It is mandatory to wear a mask in the entire school building, as well as in class and group rooms.    3-G rule also at universities and colleges  The so-called 3-G rule is also used at universities and colleges  . As in other areas of life, those who have been tested, recovered and vaccinated should be granted access to the campus. For this, the current legal basis, the 2nd COVID-19 University Act , will be extended to the coming winter semester 2021/22 until February 28, 2022 and adjusted accordingly.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/00qXI#selection-3229.0-3281.98 [Nationwide measures]  https://web.archive.org/web/20211125164101/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/W1r6U [FAQ on current university and college operations]

Corona traffic light map  "On November 25th, 2021, the Corona Commission classifies all of Austria and all federal states as a very high risk.   The classification for the education sector is risk level III."    Source: https://archive.vn/I1ZDL#selection-541.0-549.62 [Corona traffic light map]

*Nationwide measures*    Educational area  "Meetings for training and further education purposes may only take place for people from the same household. Otherwise, training and further training may only take place for as many people as is necessary.    "For elementary educational institutions, institutions for out-of-school childcare and child minders, there is an obligation to provide evidence of a negative PCR test twice a week. The test must not have been carried out more than 72 hours ago.     "The schools are open to everyone who needs them. It is mandatory to wear a mask in the entire school building, as well as in class and group rooms.    "For further binding regulations see  COVID-19 School Ordinance 2021/22  and  COVID-19 University Act .    "From week 38, the Corona Commission will determine the epidemiological risk for the educational institutions per federal state. On the basis of this classification, the Education Directorate determines the risk level for the federal state in agreement with the central office by ordinance. The responsible education directorate then informs the schools. Defined framework conditions also enable flexible measures to be taken at the school location. Further information can be found on the website of the  Federal Ministry of Education, Science and Research (BMBWF)"    *Corona traffic light map*  On December 2nd, 2021, the Corona Commission classifies all of Austria and all federal states as a very high risk.   The classification for the education sector is risk level III.    *Coronavirus - Current Measures*     School:  â¢	School for everyone who needs it  â¢	The timetable remains upright  â¢	A mask requirement applies to all school levels in the school building as well as in class and group rooms.  â¢	However, children are allowed to stay at home without a doctor's certificate. Schools provide care and learning packages for these children.  â¢	Details can be found on the website of the Ministry of Education    Sources:  https://archive.vn/K9UCW#selection-597.0-605.62 [Corona traffic light map]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

New regulations in the workplace from 01.11:  â¢	3-G proof at the workplace if contact with other people cannot be ruled out there  o	With 3-G proof, release from the mask requirement  o	Transition period up to and including November 14th: without 3-G proof, FFP2 masks are mandatory  â¢	3-G obligation for top athletes: inside  â¢	Increased test intensity for unvaccinated and unrecovered employees: inside the health and care sector  â¢	Access to workplaces in the health and care sector only with 3-G proof  â¢	Mouth and nose protection is mandatory in addition to the 3-G certificate in old people's and nursing homes as well as in hospitals  â¢	Furthermore, FFP2 mask compulsory for customers and visitors in places to cover necessary basic needs (e.g. supermarkets, pharmacies, public transport), in care and health facilities in addition to 3G  â¢	3-G proof or FFP2 mask in other customer areas (e.g. non-essential retail, travel agencies, museums)  â¢	Furthermore, no mask requirement in 3-G settings (e.g. gastronomy, accommodation providers, theaters, hairdressers, events)    Sources:  https://archive.vn/nmP8T [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/SXpx3 [FAQ]  https://web.archive.org/web/20211101214354/https://www.bma.gv.at/Services/News/Coronavirus/FAQ-3-G-am-Arbeitsplatz.html [FAQ]

Customer areas  â¢	An FFP2 mask must be worn in everyday shops such as banks, post offices, pharmacies, drugstores and in grocery stores (including sales outlets of food producers and petrol stations with affiliated sales outlets for groceries).   â¢	When entering and driving in other customer areas as well as the connecting structures of structurally connected operating facilities (e.g. shopping centers, market halls), customers who do not provide 3G proof must wear an FFP2 mask.  â¢	The operator of business premises for the use of body-friendly services is only allowed to let customers in if they can present a 3G certificate. The customer must have this proof available for the duration of the stay.    At work  â¢	Employees, owners and operators are only allowed to enter workplaces where physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out if they have a 3G certificate. Contacts within the meaning of the first sentence do not include a maximum of two physical contacts per day that take place outdoors and each do not last longer than 15 minutes.  â¢	Up to and including November 14th, employees, owners and operators who do not provide a 3G certificate are required to wear an FFP2 mask. From November 15th, a workplace may only be entered with valid 3G proof without exception.  â¢	The owner of a place of work with more than 51 employees must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	With regard to the wearing of a mask and the submission of evidence of a low epidemiological risk, stricter regulations that go beyond this ordinance can be provided in justified cases.    Leisure, sport and culture    leisure  Leisure facilities are businesses and facilities that serve entertainment, amusement or recreation. Leisure facilities are in particular:   â¢	Fairgrounds, amusement and amusement parks  â¢	Baths  â¢	Dance schools  â¢	Betting offices, slot machines, amusement arcades and casinos  â¢	Show mines  â¢	Facilities for the practice of prostitution  â¢	Indoor playgrounds  â¢	Paintball systems  â¢	Museum railways  â¢	Animal parks, zoos and botanical gardens    The following applies in this area:  â¢	Customers must show a 3G certificate, which must be kept available for the duration of their stay.  â¢	Every leisure company must create a prevention concept and appoint a COVID-19 officer.    Culture  â¢	In museums, art halls and cultural exhibition halls, libraries, libraries and archives, people who do not provide 3G proof must wear an FFP2 mask.  â¢	For cultural institutions in which mainly get-togethers take place, such as theaters, cinemas, variety theaters, cabarets, concert halls and arenas, a 3G certificate, a COVID-19 officer and a prevention concept are required.    Sports  â¢	The 3G rule applies to sports facilities. The proof must be kept ready for the duration of the stay.   â¢	Operators of non-public sports facilities must create a Covid-19 prevention concept and appoint a Covid-19 officer.  â¢	Top athletes:  	o	When top athletes practice sport, the responsible doctor must develop a COVID-19 prevention concept and monitor compliance with it on an ongoing basis.  	o	Top athletes have to show a 3G certificate for training and competitions if physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out.  	o	If a SARS-CoV-2 infection becomes known to an athlete, supervisor or trainer, all athletes, supervisors and trainers must undergo a molecular biological test or an antigen test for the presence of a SARS-CoV- 2 to undergo infection.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/J7wJi - Nationwide Measures  https://archive.vn/ouA5Z - Current Measures

Current measures from November 8, 2021    3-G becomes 2-G: Wherever 3-G was previously in effect, only vaccinated and recovered people have access. This applies to:  â¢	body-hugging services,  â¢	Gastronomy, night gastronomy, Christmas markets, hotels and similar settings,  â¢	the cultural sector (theaters, cinemas and operas, but not museums),  â¢	Sports and leisure facilities  â¢	Visits to hospitals and old people's and nursing homes, with the exception of visits as part of palliative and hospice support or support during childbirth. An FFP 2 mask must also be worn in closed rooms .  Transition period until December 6th, 2021: Until then, access is also possible with a first vaccination and an additional PCR test.     Workplace : In principle, the 3-G rule applies; stricter rules are prescribed in particularly sensitive areas.  â¢	Employees in night catering and at major events (from 250 participants) who have neither been vaccinated nor recovered can also show a valid PCR test. However, only people who have been tested for PCR must also wear an FFP 2 mask.  â¢	The same rule applies to employees in health and care facilities. So only tested people have to wear an FFP 2 mask. In addition, mouth and nose protection is required in this setting for vaccinated and convalescent people.  â¢	Antibody tests are no longer valid as G detection.    A 2.5 G rule (vaccinated, recovered or PCR-tested) has already been in effect for employees in the following areas since November 8: Night restaurants, discos, aprÃ¨s-ski, elderly, care and residential facilities for the disabled, in hospitals, in mobile care and support and at events with over 250 participants.    There is a transition period up to and including November 14th. During the period, people who cannot produce a 3-G certificate are required to wear an FFP2 mask for the entire working time    Sources:  https://web.archive.org/web/20211112143651/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html  https://archive.vn/dA29v  https://archive.vn/hWG2m  https://archive.vn/wxXb4  https://archive.vn/a3vmo

In Vienna  For the federal state of Vienna, the following additional, stricter measures apply from November 12th (until December 12th) :    Job  For all places of professional activity in Vienna, in addition to the nationwide measures, a 2.5G proof (PCR test max. 48 hours old) applies.    Gastronomy   For customers, the 2G regulation applies to snack and restaurant stands.    Source; https://archive.vn/Dj4ZE [Vienna measurements]

At work (nationwide guidelines)  â¢	Employees, owners and operators are only allowed to enter workplaces where physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out if they have a 3G certificate. Contacts within the meaning of the first sentence do not include a maximum of two physical contacts per day that take place outdoors and each do not last longer than 15 minutes.  â¢	The owner of a place of work with more than 51 employees must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	With regard to the wearing of a mask and the submission of evidence of a low epidemiological risk, stricter regulations that go beyond this ordinance can be provided in justified cases.  â¢	A 2G rule generally applies to employees of night-time catering establishments and major events (from 250 participants) at the workplace. Alternatively, a valid PCR test can also be presented, in which case an FFP2 mask must also be worn.  â¢	Workplaces in the health and care sector may only be entered with a 2G certificate. In retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled as well as in hospitals and health resorts and other places where health services are provided, in addition to the 2G proof, it is also compulsory to wear mouth and nose protection in closed rooms. Alternatively, a valid PCR test can also be presented; an FFP2 mask must also be worn here.    Customer areas  â¢	Customers may only enter customer areas of business premises for the purpose of purchasing goods or using services if they have 2G evidence (exceptions to the point of exit regulation or the 5th COVID-19 Protective Measures Ordinance ).  â¢	When entering and driving in the customer area of business premises, as well as the connecting structures of structurally connected business premises (e.g. shopping centers, market halls), customers must wear an FFP2 mask in closed rooms.  â¢	The operator of business premises for the use of body-friendly services is only allowed to let customers in if they can present proof of 2G. The customer must have this proof available for the duration of the stay.    In Vienna  â¢	For all places of professional activity in Vienna, in addition to the nationwide measures, a 2.5G proof (PCR test max. 48 hours old) applies.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/WYxDd#selection-1977.0-2045.91 [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/FID4b {Vienna]

At work  â¢	Employees, owners and operators are only allowed to enter workplaces where physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out if they have a 3G certificate. Contacts within the meaning of the first sentence do not include a maximum of two physical contacts per day that take place outdoors and each do not last longer than 15 minutes.  â¢	The owner of a place of work with more than 51 employees must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	With regard to the wearing of a mask and the submission of evidence of a low epidemiological risk, stricter regulations that go beyond this ordinance can be provided in justified cases.  â¢	For employees of night-time catering establishments and of major events (from 250 participants: inside) a 2G rule generally applies at the workplace. Alternatively, a valid PCR test can also be presented, in which case an FFP2 mask must also be worn. (Exception: operators: inside, employees may, as an exception, admit an authorized body with a negative antigen test, provided that no negative PCR test can be presented due to lack of availability or an evaluation that is not timely. This also applies accordingly to the operators: Inside).  â¢	Workplaces in the health and care sector may only be entered with a 2G certificate. In old people's and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled as well as in hospitals and spa facilities and other places where health services are provided, in addition to the 2G proof, it is also mandatory to wear mouth and nose protection in closed rooms. Alternatively, a valid PCR test can also be presented; an FFP2 mask must also be worn here. (Exception: operators: inside, employees may, as an exception, admit an authorized body with a negative antigen test, provided that no negative PCR test can be presented due to lack of availability or an evaluation that is not timely. This also applies accordingly to the operators: Inside).    Sources:  https://archive.vn/kqgPP [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/EYqru [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

At work  â¢	The professional activity should preferably take place outside the workplace, if this is possible and both employer: in and employee: in agree.  â¢	Employees, owners and operators may only enter workplaces where physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out if they have a 3G certificate. (A maximum of two physical contacts per day, which take place outdoors and each do not last longer than 15 minutes, are not considered to be contacts).  â¢	An FFP2 mask should be worn if physical contact with people cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	The owner of a place of work with more than 51 employees must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	With regard to the wearing of a mask and the submission of evidence of a low epidemiological risk, stricter regulations that go beyond this ordinance can be provided in justified cases.  â¢	If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability or an evaluation that is not timely, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they present 3G evidence. This also applies to operators.  â¢	Workplaces in the health and care sector may only be entered with 2G evidence and an additional negative PCR test. In retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled as well as in hospitals and health resorts and other places where health services are provided, wearing an FFP2 mask in closed rooms is also mandatory. (Exception: Operator: inside, employees may, as an exception, also let in with a negative antigen test from an authorized body, provided that no negative PCR test can be presented due to lack of availability or an evaluation that is not timely. This also applies accordingly to the operator: Inside).    Customer areas  â¢	Business premises of the trade, body-related services and leisure or cultural facilities are not allowed to be entered. The exception is the collection of pre-ordered goods, whereby an FFP2 mask must be worn.  â¢	Customer areas for services that are not close to the body may only be entered with 2G proof.  â¢	There are exceptions for business premises for daily needs, such as pharmacies, grocery stores, banks, petrol stations, etc.  â¢	Entering the customer area of business premises is only permitted for customers with an FFP2 mask. If the customer cannot wear an FFP2 mask due to the nature of the service, this is only permitted if the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.    Leisure, sport and culture    Leisure  Leisure facilities (such as leisure and amusement parks, baths, dance schools, facilities for practicing prostitution, animal parks, etc.) are closed.    Culture and culture  Art and cultural institutions (museums, art halls, cultural exhibition halls, libraries, libraries, archives, theaters, cinemas, variety theaters, cabarets, concert halls and arenas) are closed.    Sports  â¢	Indoor sports facilities are closed (exceptions: outdoor sports facilities, top athletes, disabled sports, professional athletes and their supervisors and trainers as well as representatives of the media).  â¢	Outdoor sports facilities are open, whereby the exercise of sports may only take place with people who live in the same household, the partner who does not live in the same household, individual closest relatives such as parents, children and siblings or individual important caregivers.  â¢	Top athletes:  	o	When top athletes practice sport, the responsible doctor must develop a COVID-19 prevention concept and monitor compliance with it on an ongoing basis.  	o	Top athletes, as well as their supervisors and trainers, have to show a 3G certificate for training and competitions if physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out.  	o	If a SARS-CoV-2 infection becomes known to an athlete, supervisor or trainer, all athletes, supervisors and trainers must undergo a molecular biological test or an antigen test for the presence of a SARS-CoV- 2 to undergo infection.    Gastronomy and accommodation    Gastronomy  â¢	The catering is closed.  â¢	(Exceptions are catering establishments in hospitals and health resorts, old people's and nursing homes as well as inpatient residential facilities for the disabled, facilities for the care and accommodation of children and young people and companies for people who are exclusively cared for, accommodated or not staying there for mere visits).  â¢	There is an FFP2 mask requirement for customers. Furthermore, the consumption of food and drinks is not permitted in the immediate vicinity of the dispensing point and may only be consumed while sitting at the dispensing stations. Self-service is permitted, provided that the risk of infection can be minimized through special hygienic precautions.  â¢	With the FFP2 mask, it is permitted to collect food and non-alcoholic beverages as well as alcoholic beverages that are filled in commercially available sealed containers.    Accommodation  â¢	Accommodation establishments (including campsites and shelters) are closed.  â¢	(Exceptions, the purpose of looking after and providing assistance to people in need of support, professional reasons that cannot be postponed, satisfying an urgent need for housing, spa guests or patients and their accompanying persons in a spa or rehabilitation facility, as well as for pupils for the purpose of attending school and students Study purposes).  â¢	Persons who were already in accommodation at the time this provision came into force or for whom in advance with the accommodation provider: in the agreed period of accommodation, an exception can be made.  â¢	When entering the FFP2 mask requirement applies.    Gastronomy  â¢	The catering is closed.  â¢	(Exceptions are catering establishments in hospitals and health resorts, old people's and nursing homes as well as inpatient residential facilities for the disabled, facilities for the care and accommodation of children and young people and companies for people who are exclusively cared for, accommodated or not staying there for mere visits).  â¢	There is an FFP2 mask requirement for customers. Furthermore, the consumption of food and drinks is not permitted in the immediate vicinity of the dispensing point and may only be consumed while sitting at the dispensing stations. Self-service is permitted, provided that the risk of infection can be minimized through special hygienic precautions.  â¢	With the FFP2 mask, it is permitted to collect food and non-alcoholic beverages as well as alcoholic beverages that are filled in commercially available sealed containers.    Accommodation  â¢	Accommodation establishments (including campsites and shelters) are closed.  â¢	(Exceptions, the purpose of looking after and providing assistance to people in need of support, professional reasons that cannot be postponed, satisfying an urgent need for housing, spa guests or patients and their accompanying persons in a spa or rehabilitation facility, as well as for pupils for the purpose of attending school and students Study purposes).  â¢	Persons who were already in accommodation at the time this provision came into force or for whom in advance with the accommodation provider: in the agreed period of accommodation, an exception can be made.  â¢	When entering the FFP2 mask requirement applies.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/00qXI [Nationwide measures]  https://web.archive.org/web/20211125164101/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

*Nationwide measures*  At work  â¢	The professional activity should preferably take place outside the workplace, if this is possible and both employer: in and employee: in agree.  â¢	Employees, owners and operators are only allowed to enter workplaces where physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out if they have a 3G certificate. (A maximum of two physical contacts per day, which take place outdoors and each do not last longer than 15 minutes, are not considered to be contacts).  â¢	An FFP2 mask should be worn if physical contact with people cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	The owner of a place of work with more than 51 employees must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	With regard to the wearing of a mask and the submission of evidence of a low epidemiological risk, stricter regulations that go beyond this ordinance can be provided in justified cases.  â¢	If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability, an evaluation that is not timely or due to the unpredictability of the business activity to be performed, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they have 3G evidence submit. This also applies to operators.  â¢	Workplaces in the health and care sector may only be entered with a 2G proof and an additional negative PCR test. In retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled as well as in hospitals and health resorts and other places where health services are provided, wearing an FFP2 mask in closed rooms is also mandatory. (Exception: operators: inside, employees may, as an exception, admit an authorized body with a negative antigen test, provided that no negative PCR test can be presented due to lack of availability or an evaluation that is not timely. This also applies accordingly to the operators: Inside).    Customer areas  â¢	Business premises of the trade, body-related services and leisure or cultural facilities are not allowed to be entered. The exception is the collection of pre-ordered goods, whereby an FFP2 mask must be worn. In addition, retail outlets may not be open longer than 7 p.m.  â¢	Customer areas for services that are not close to the body may only be entered with 2G proof.  â¢	There are exceptions for operating facilities for daily needs such as pharmacies, grocery stores, banks, (electricity) filling stations, etc.  â¢	Entering the customer area of business premises is only permitted for customers with an FFP2 mask. If, due to the nature of the service, the customer cannot wear an FFP2 mask, this is only permitted if the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.    Gastronomy and accommodation    Gastronomy  â¢	The catering is closed.  â¢	(Exceptions are catering establishments in hospitals and health resorts, old people's and nursing homes as well as inpatient residential facilities for the disabled, facilities for the care and accommodation of children and young people and companies for people who are exclusively cared for, accommodated or not staying there for mere visits).  â¢	There is an FFP2 mask requirement for customers. Furthermore, the consumption of food and drinks is not permitted in the immediate vicinity of the dispensing point and may only be consumed while sitting at the dispensing stations. Self-service is permitted, provided that the risk of infection can be minimized through special hygienic precautions.  â¢	With the FFP2 mask, it is permitted to collect food and alcohol-free beverages as well as alcoholic beverages that are filled in commercially available sealed containers.    Accommodation  â¢	Accommodation establishments (including campsites and shelters) are closed.  â¢	(Exceptions, the purpose of looking after and providing assistance to people in need of support, professional reasons that cannot be postponed, satisfying an urgent need for housing, spa guests or patients and their accompanying persons in a spa or rehabilitation facility, as well as for pupils for the purpose of attending school and students Study purposes).  â¢	Persons who were already in accommodation at the time this provision came into force or for whom in advance with the accommodation provider: in the agreed period of accommodation, an exception can be made.  â¢	When entering the FFP2 mask requirement applies.    Leisure, sport and culture    Leisure  Leisure facilities (such as leisure and amusement parks, baths, dance schools, facilities for practicing prostitution, animal parks, etc.) are closed.    Culture and culture  Art and cultural institutions (museums, art halls, cultural exhibition halls, libraries, libraries, archives, theaters, cinemas, variety theaters, cabarets, concert halls and arenas) are closed.    Sport  â¢	Indoor sports facilities are closed (exceptions: outdoor sports facilities, top athletes, disabled sports, professional athletes and their supervisors and trainers as well as representatives of the media).  â¢	Outdoor sports facilities are open, but sports may only be practiced with people who live in the same household, the partner who does not live in the same household, individual closest relatives such as parents, children and siblings or individual important caregivers. Lingering in the sports facility is limited to the duration of the exercise.  o	Only sports without physical contact may be practiced.  o	In non-public sports facilities, only people with a 2G certificate have access.  o	Closed areas of the sports facility may only be entered if this is necessary for outdoor sports.  â¢	Top athletes:  o	When top athletes practice sports, the responsible doctor must develop a COVID-19 prevention concept and monitor compliance with it on an ongoing basis.  o	Top athletes, as well as their supervisors and trainers, have to show a 3G certificate for training and competitions if physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out.  o	If a SARS-CoV-2 infection becomes known to an athlete, supervisor or trainer, all athletes, supervisors and trainers must undergo a molecular biological test or an antigen test for the presence of a SARS-CoV- 2 to undergo infection.      *Coronavirus - Current Measures*    Place of professional activity:  â¢ General home office recommendation, federal employees also work from home    Customer areas, trade & services:  â¢ Business premises of the trade as well as body-related services, leisure facilities and cultural facilities are not allowed to be entered.  â¢ Customer areas for services that are not close to the body may only be entered upon presentation of a 2-G certificate. Customers also have to wear a mask. If this is not possible due to the nature of the service, other suitable protective measures must be taken to minimize the risk of infection.  â¢ Exceptions are permanent establishments of the universal service. Only goods may be offered that correspond to the typical range of goods at the business premises. Here customers have to wear an FFP 2 mask, for example :  	o	public pharmacies  	o	Grocery retailers and farm direct marketers  	o	Drug stores and drug stores  	o	Banks  	o	Gas stations  â¢ The opening times of the retail outlets that sell goods are limited to 7 p.m.    Gastronomy:  â¢ Gastronomy facilities may only be entered for the collection of food and alcohol-free alcoholic beverages that are filled in commercially closed containers. A mask must be worn here. Consumption is not permitted within a 50 m radius .  â¢ Take away from restaurants is still possible all day.  â¢ Advent and Christmas markets are currently not allowed to take place.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]

Meetings  In general:    In principle, there are no longer any maximum limits and capacity restrictions.  â¢	There is no longer a mask requirement at events.  â¢	Meetings with more than 25 participants are only permitted on the condition that the person responsible for the meeting only allows the participants to enter if they can present a 3G certificate.  â¢	Meetings of 100 people or more are notifiable. On the part of the participants: inside a 3G-proof is to be presented, which is to be checked by the responsible persons. He must also develop and implement a prevention concept and appoint a COVID-19 officer.  â¢	Meetings of 500 people or more must be approved. The 3G rule also applies here. A prevention concept and the appointment of a COVID-19 officer is required.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/J7wJi - Nationwide Measures  https://archive.vn/ouA5Z - Current Measures

The following applies to events :  â¢	More than 25 participants: 2G compulsory  â¢	More than 50 participants: obligation to notify the district administrative authority up to 1 week before the event, appointment of a COVID-19 officer , creation of a prevention concept  â¢	More than 250 participants: approval from the district administrative authority required    For specialist and public fairs, as well as occasional markets (including Advent and Christmas markets), the regulations governing get-togethers apply. The organizers have to appoint a COVID-19 officer and work out and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept. For customers, when entering and driving in other customer areas as well as the connecting structures of structurally connected operating facilities in closed rooms, an FFP2 mask is required.    Sources:  https://web.archive.org/web/20211112143651/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html  https://archive.vn/dA29v

Measures for the entire federal state of Upper Austria    Trade and public fairs; Leisure and cultural facilities  â¢	Trade and public fairs are prohibited.  â¢	2G proof for customers in all cultural institutions.  â¢	Meetings in event venues only if they are held all year round and regularly.    Meetings  â¢	Meetings are prohibited (with the exception of: club activities, facilities for adult education and for sports, funerals, assemblies, extracurricular youth education, meetings in the context of top-class or professional sports events, provided that structural and organizational measures in the sports facility are ensured).     Markets and Occasional Markets  â¢	FFP2 mask compulsory for all persons on the entire site.  â¢	It is forbidden to consume food and beverages anywhere on the site. 'Leaving your own private living space for the purpose of attending meetings is only permitted for the following meetings' - so in effect gatherings are restricted to those in the private living space for most citizens.    Meetings  â¢	Leaving your own private living space for the purpose of attending meetings is only permitted for the following meetings:  o	Funerals  o	Assemblies according to the assembly law  o	Meetings for professional purposes, if these are necessary to maintain the professional activity  o	meetings of organs of political persons cannot be postponed if they cannot be held in digital form  o	meetings of bodies of legal persons that cannot be postponed, provided that they cannot be held in digital form  o	meetings that cannot be postponed under the Labor Constitution Act  o	Meetings for absolutely necessary vocational training and further education purposes, to fulfill the necessary integration measures according to the Integration Act and for final professional examinations, if it is not possible to hold them in digital form  o	Meetings of medical and psychosocial self-help groups  If not all participants have a 2G certificate at these gatherings, an FFP2 mask must be worn.  â¢	The following applies to meetings for rehearsals for professional purposes and for professional artistic performance in a fixed composition:  o	 the 3G rule, when physical contact with other people cannot be excluded.  o	In addition, the person responsible for the meeting must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	For meetings within the framework of the labor market service, as well as for other meetings for absolutely necessary vocational training and further education purposes, the 3G certificate applies if physical contact cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	Other exceptions for meetings:  o	Elite sport.  o	Driving into theaters, concert halls and arenas, cinemas, variety theaters and cabarets, if this is done with multi-lane vehicles.  o	rehearsals and artistic performances in a fixed composition without an audience, which are carried out for professional purposes.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/lFJFe [5th COVID-19 Emergency Measures Ordinance]  https://archive.vn/00qXI [Nationwide measures]  https://web.archive.org/web/20211125164101/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

In general, gatherings are kept to those within the household as exit restrictions are in place.  However there are exceptions:    Meetings  â¢	Leaving your own private living space for the purpose of attending meetings is only permitted for the following meetings:  o	Funerals  o	Assemblies according to the assembly law  o	Meetings for professional purposes, if these are necessary to maintain the professional activity  o	meetings of organs of political persons cannot be postponed if they cannot be held in digital form  o	meetings of bodies of legal persons that cannot be postponed, provided that they cannot be held in digital form  o	meetings that cannot be postponed under the Labor Constitution Act  o	Meetings for absolutely necessary vocational training and further education purposes, for the fulfillment of necessary integration measures according to the Integration Act and for final professional examinations, if it is not possible to hold them in digital form  o	Meetings of medical and psychosocial self-help groups  â¢	Personal assistance and 24-hour care are not included in the maximum number of people or households.  If not all participants have a 2G certificate at these gatherings, an FFP2 mask must be worn.  â¢	The following applies to meetings for rehearsals for professional purposes and for professional artistic performance in a fixed composition:  o	 the 3G rule, when physical contact with other people cannot be excluded.  o	In addition, the person responsible for the meeting must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	For meetings within the framework of the labor market service, as well as for other meetings for absolutely necessary vocational training and further education purposes, the 3G certificate applies if physical contact cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	Other exceptions for meetings:  o	Elite sport.  o	Driving in theaters, concert halls and arenas, cinemas, variety theaters and cabarets, if this is done with multi-lane vehicles.  o	rehearsals and artistic performances in a fixed composition without an audience, which are carried out for professional purposes. Public transport    An FFP2 mask must be worn in closed rooms when using taxis and taxi-like companies, cable cars and rack and pinion railways for mass transportation and in the associated stations, platforms, stops, train stations and airports as well as their respective connecting structures.    The following applies to the use of cable cars and cogwheel railways:    The operator may only let people in if they have a 3G certificate. The person must keep this proof available for the duration of the stay  An FFP2 mask must be worn in closed or coverable vehicles (gondolas, cabins, coverable armchairs) and in the closed rooms of the associated stations.  The operator of cable cars and cog railways has to appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  The following applies to the use of coaches and excursion boats in occasional traffic:    The operator may only let people in if they have a 3G certificate. The person must keep this proof available for the duration of the stay.  The operator must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/J7wJi - Nationwide Measures  https://archive.vn/ouA5Z - Current Measures

Public transport  An FFP2 mask must be worn in closed rooms when using taxis and taxi-like companies, school transports, cable cars and rack-and-pinion railways, mass transportation and the associated stations, platforms, stops, train stations and airports as well as their respective connecting structures.    The following applies to the use of cable cars and cogwheel railways:  The operator may only let people in if they can show proof of 2G. The person must have this proof available for the duration of the stay.  People who use the cable car or cogwheel train to cover basic needs of daily life do not have to provide proof of 2G, but wear an FFP2 mask.  The operator of cable cars and cog railways has to appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.    The following applies to the use of coaches and excursion boats in occasional traffic:  The operator may only let people in if they can show proof of 2G. The person must have this proof available for the duration of the stay.  The operator must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.    Sources:  https://web.archive.org/web/20211112143651/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html  https://archive.vn/dA29v

Exit regulation  For people who do not have 2G proof, leaving their own private living area (including residential units in accommodation establishments as well as in old people's, nursing and handicapped homes) and staying outside their own private living area is only permitted for the following purposes:  1.	Avoidance of an immediate danger to life, limb and property.  2.	Care of and assistance for people in need of support as well as exercise of family rights and fulfilment of family duties.  3.	Covering the basic needs of daily life.  4.	professional and educational purposes.  5.	Staying outdoors alone, with people from the common household, life partners who do not live in the common household, individual closest relatives (parents, children and siblings), individual important caregivers.  6.	to pursue administrative or judicial processes that cannot be postponed.  7.	to participate in elections provided by law and to use the instruments of direct democracy provided by law.  8.	for the purpose of entering customer areas of certain business premises such as pharmacies, grocery stores, drugstores, health and care services, petrol stations, banks, postal service providers, car and bicycle workshops, picking up pre-ordered meals, ..).    Source:  https://archive.vn/WYxDd [Nationwide measures]

Exit regulation  All-day exit restrictions apply. Leaving your own private living area and staying outside your own private living area is only permitted for the following purposes:  â¢	Avoidance of immediate danger to life, limb and property.  â¢	Care of and assistance for people in need of support as well as exercise of family rights and fulfillment of family duties.  â¢	Covering the necessary basic needs of daily life, such as contact with the partner who does not live in the same household, individual close relatives (parents, children and siblings) and important reference persons, the supply of basic goods of daily life, the use of health services, the coverage a need for housing, the satisfaction of basic religious needs, as well as the care of animals.  â¢	professional and educational purposes.  â¢	Staying outdoors alone, with people from the common household or people for physical and mental relaxation.  â¢	to pursue administrative or judicial processes that cannot be postponed.  â¢	to participate in elections provided by law and to use the instruments of direct democracy provided by law.  â¢	for the purpose of entering customer areas of certain business premises such as pharmacies, grocery stores, drugstores, health and care services, petrol stations, banks, postal service providers, car and bicycle workshops, picking up pre-ordered meals, etc.).    Sources:  https://archive.vn/lFJFe [5th COVID-19 Emergency Measures Ordinance]  https://archive.vn/00qXI [Nationwide measures]  https://web.archive.org/web/20211125164101/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

Entry from states and areas with a low epidemiological risk (Annex 1) with a 2.5 G certificate.  Entry from virus variant areas and states (Appendix 2) "States and areas with a high incidence of virus variants are listed in Appendix 2 . In general, you are banned from entering Austria with only a few exceptions.  No states or areas are currently listed on Appendix 2."    Regulations for entering Austria  The 7th amendment of the COVID-19 Entry Ordinance 2021 comes into force on November 22nd . It brings the following innovations for entry into Austria:  â¢	When entering the country, a 2.5 G certificate is generally required,  â¢	Antigen and antibody tests lose their validity as evidence. Exceptions are:    o	Commuters: inside (work, school / study, family purposes, life partner: in): You need a 3-G certificate .  o	People who are subject to compulsory schooling: The ninja pass is valid as proof of a low epidemiological risk. This applies in the week in which the test intervals are adhered to, also on the Friday, Saturday and Sunday of this week and (if testing is ensured immediately after entry) on the Monday of the following week  â¢	The previously privileged duration of PCR tests of 7 days for commuters will be shortened to a validity of 72 hours. Antigen tests are only valid for 24 hours.  â¢	Vaccination certificate:  o	The minimum interval between vaccinations against the coronavirus must be 14 days.  o	The period of validity of the vaccination certificate will be shortened. The proof is only valid for 9 months, with a transition period until December 6th.    Sources:   https://web.archive.org/web/20211125164101/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html  https://archive.vn/sM8jr [FAQ : Entry into Austria]  https://archive.vn/VdXdq [quarantine requirement specifics]  https://archive.vn/Hu6NG [Entry Regulations for Austria - Austria.info]

Regulations for entering Austria  The 8th amendment to the COVID-19 Entry Ordinance 2021 comes into force on November 27th . Due to the new virus variant Omicron, there is a tightening of the entry into Austria:  â¢	Classification of the following countries as virus variant areas ("Appendix 2 of the Entry Regulation "):  Botswana, Eswatini, Lesotho, Mozambique, Namibia, Zimbabwe, South Africa  â¢	Entry from these countries is generally prohibited  â¢	Essentially, only Austrian citizens and people with a place of residence or habitual abode in Austria are allowed to enter the country. Entry for humanitarian reasons or in the urgent interest of the republic is also possible. There are also a few other exceptions.  â¢	The following rules apply to these people upon entry:  o	Registration for pre-travel clearance at https://entry.ptc.gv.at/  o	Presentation of a negative molecular biological test result ( PCR test); the sampling must not be more than 72 hours ago  o	Immediate start of a ten-day quarantine. The quarantine is deemed to have ended if a further PCR test is carried out at the earliest on the fifth day after entry , the result of which is negative. The day of entry is to be regarded as "day zero".  â¢	 In addition, flights from these seven African countries will be banned from landing.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/QppwY [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://web.archive.org/web/20211129210334/https://www.ris.bka.gv.at/Dokumente/BgblAuth/BGBLA_2021_II_492/BGBLA_2021_II_492.html [492. Ordinance of the Federal Minister for Social Affairs, Health, Care and Consumer Protection on the landing ban of aircraft from SARS-CoV-2 virus variant areas and states]

Regulations for entering Austria  The 8th amendment to the COVID-19 Entry Ordinance 2021 comes into force on November 27th . Due to the new virus variant Omicron, there is a tightening of the entry into Austria:     â¢ Classification of the following countries as virus variant areas ("Appendix 2 of the Entry Regulation "):  Botswana, Eswatini, Lesotho, Mozambique, Namibia, Zimbabwe, South Africa     â¢ Entry from these countries is generally prohibited     â¢ In essence, only Austrian citizens and people with a place of residence or habitual abode in Austria are allowed to enter the country. Entry for humanitarian reasons or in the urgent interest of the republic is also possible. There are also a few other exceptions.     â¢ The following rules apply to these people upon entry:  	o Registration for pre-travel clearance at https://entry.ptc.gv.at/  	o Presentation of a negative molecular biological test result ( PCR test); the sampling must not be more than 72 hours ago  	o Immediate start of a ten-day quarantine. The quarantine is deemed to have ended if a further PCR test is carried out at the earliest on the fifth day after entry, the result of which is negative. The day of entry is to be regarded as "day zero".     â¢ In addition, flights from these seven African countries will be banned from landing.    Source: https://archive.vn/5GEjm#selection-2627.0-2879.85 [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

Clearance and mouth and nose protection  A mask (FFP2 mask without exhalation valve or a mask with at least an equivalent standardized standard) must be worn wherever 2G verification is not required. In addition to public transport and essential trade, this also applies to non-essential trade and to customer areas, museums and libraries.    Children up to the age of 6 do not have to wear an FFP2 mask or an MNS. Children from the age of 6 up to the age of 14 are also allowed to wear an MNS. Pregnant women are also allowed to wear an MNS.    Sources:  https://web.archive.org/web/20211112143651/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html  https://archive.vn/dA29v

Clearance and mouth and nose protection  When entering public places in closed rooms, an FFP2 mask or a mask with at least an equivalent standardized standard must be worn.   Children up to the age of 6 do not have to wear an FFP2 mask or an MNS. Children from the age of 6 up to the age of 14 may also wear an MNS or a close-fitting mechanical protective device. Pregnant women are also allowed to wear an MNS or a close-fitting mechanical protective device.  A distance of 2 meters should be kept to people outside the household.    *Upper Austria. COVID-19 Measures Accompanying Ordinance 2021*  For the federal state of Upper Austria, the following additional, stricter measures will apply from November 15 (until December 5):  Expansion of the FFP2 mask requirement  â¢	In coaches and excursion boats in occasional traffic.  â¢	Customers in establishments of the hospitality industry if they are not at the administration point.  â¢	Guests of accommodation establishments in generally accessible areas.  â¢	Places of occupational activity, provided that physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out and the risk of infection cannot be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	Markets and occasional markets, also outdoors.  means of transport  â¢	FFP2 mask requirement and 2G proof for coaches and excursion boats in occasional traffic.  Hospitality  â¢	FFP2 mask requirement for customers from the first time they enter until they are seated at the administration point. When leaving the administration area, there is a one-meter distance to other people and an FFP2 mask is mandatory.  â¢	Consumption of food and drinks only while seated at the dispensing point and not in the immediate vicinity of the dispensing point.  â¢	Administration areas are to be set up in such a way that there is a distance of at least one meter between the groups of visitors. This does not apply if the risk of infection can be minimized through suitable protective measures for spatial separation.  â¢	The 2G rule applies to the consumption of food and drinks at snack bars and catering stands.  â¢	The night catering is closed.  Accommodation establishments  â¢	FFP2 mask requirement in generally accessible areas for guests.  Meetings  â¢	Meetings are prohibited (with the exception of: club activities, facilities for adult education and sports, funerals, assemblies, extracurricular youth education, meetings in the context of events of top-class or professional sport, provided that structural and organizational measures in the sports facility are ensured).  Trade and public fairs; Leisure and cultural facilities  â¢	Trade and public fairs are prohibited.  â¢	2G proof for customers in all cultural institutions.  â¢	Meetings in event venues only if they are held all year round and regularly.  Places of professional activity  â¢	FFP2 mask requirement if physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out and the risk of infection cannot be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	2.5G proof for employees, owners and operators in restaurants, hotels and leisure and cultural facilities (comes into force on December 5, 2021) .   Markets and Occasional Markets  â¢	FFP2 mask compulsory for all persons on the entire site.  â¢	It is forbidden to consume food and beverages anywhere on the site.    *Burgenland COVID-19 Measures Accompanying Ordinance 2021*  From November 17, 2021, an additional FFP2 mask is mandatory:  â¢	in coaches and excursion boats in occasional traffic.  â¢	for customers while using body-friendly services.  â¢	For customers: inside all types of establishments in the hospitality industry (the mask may be removed while sitting at the administration point. The mask may only be removed while standing for the purpose of consuming food and beverages).  â¢	for guests in generally accessible areas in accommodation establishments (in particular lobby, reception, corridors, elevators, staircases).  â¢	for customers of leisure and cultural institutions. This does not apply in wet areas and for activities that correspond to the purpose of the facility and are associated with physical exertion.  â¢	for participants in trade and public fairs in closed rooms. In addition, food and drinks may only be consumed at the administration point.    *Measures for the entire federal state of Lower Austria*  NÃ COVID-19 Measures Accompanying Ordinance 2021  From November 17, 2021 (until December 15, 2021) an additional FFP2 mask is required:  â¢	In the hospitality industry, with the exception of lingering at the administration point. This does not apply to the administration and consumption of food and drinks outdoors.  â¢	In the interiors of cultural institutions, in particular theaters, cinemas, variety theaters, cabarets, concert halls and arenas.      Sources  : https://archive.vn/00qXI#selection-1477.0-1551.70 [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/pQOtk [Upper Austria]  https://archive.vn/t9WjJ  [Burgenland]  https://archive.vn/UYpxp [Lower Austria]

Clearance and mouth and nose protection  When entering public places in closed rooms, an FFP2 mask or a mask with at least an equivalent standardized standard must be worn.     Children up to the age of 6 do not have to wear an FFP2 mask or an MNS. Children from the age of 6 up to the age of 14 may also wear an MNS or a close-fitting mechanical protective device. Pregnant women are also allowed to wear an MNS or a close-fitting mechanical protective device.    A distance of 2 meters should be kept to people outside the household.    An FFP2 mask must be worn in closed rooms when using cable cars and cog railways, mass transportation and the associated stations, platforms, stops, train stations and airports as well as their respective connecting structures.    Entering the customer area of ??business premises is only permitted for customers with an FFP2 mask. If, due to the nature of the service, the customer cannot wear an FFP2 mask, this is only permitted if the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.    At work an FFP2 mask should be worn if physical contact with people cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]

Retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled    It is forbidden to enter retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled.  â¢	Exceptions:  o	Residents  o	People who are required to care for the residents or to operate the facility,  o	Visits as part of palliative and hospice support, pastoral care and support in critical life events,  o	Visits with a maximum of two people per resident per day,  o	In addition, a maximum of two people per resident in need of support per day, if they perform regular support and care tasks,  o	an additional maximum of two people per day to accompany underage residents of inpatient residential facilities for the disabled  o	external service providers, legally defined representatives, bodies of care supervision or members of established commissions.   â¢	Residents should wear an FFP2 mask in places that are generally accessible and not part of the living area.  â¢	If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability, an evaluation that is not timely or due to the unpredictability of the business activity to be performed, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they have 3G evidence submit. This also applies to operators.  â¢	The  planned measures must not be disproportionate or lead to unreasonable hardship.    The following applies to visitors:  â¢	The operator may only let in visitors and accompanying persons if they can show proof of 2G and also have a negative PCR test that was not accepted more than 72 hours ago. In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.  â¢	The visitor or the accompanying person must have this proof available for the duration of the stay.  â¢	The operator may only let in visitors and accompanying persons if they wear an FFP2 mask at all times during the visit or stay.    The following applies to employees:   â¢	The operator is only allowed to let employees in if they show proof of 2G. Alternatively, a valid PCR test can be presented. In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.  â¢	Employees must wear an FFP2 mask in closed rooms.    The following applies to operators:  â¢	The operator of retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled may only let residents in for new admission if they can present a 2.5G certificate.  â¢	The operator of retirement and nursing homes must offer the residents an antigen test for SARS-CoV-2 or a molecular-biological test for SARS-CoV-2 at least every three days if they have left the home within this period.  â¢	The operator must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]

Travellers can now visit Azerbaijan under the following conditions:  submission of an official document issued by the relevant country (COVID passport) on complete vaccination or recovery from COVID-19 for passengers over 18 years of age and a negative PCR test taken within 72 hours before the flight  submission of a negative PCR test taken within 72 hours before the flight for passengers aged from 1 to 18 years.     https://web.archive.org/web/20211106152927/https://azerbaijan.travel/covid-19-en

Quote: "Citizens and legal residents of several countries, including Austria, Bahrain, Belgium, Canada, China, Croatia, the Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Luxembourg, Malta, the Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Qatar, Russia, Serbia, Singapore, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, the UAE, the UK, and the US are allowed to travel to Azerbaijan by air without the previously required special permission provided they meet the following conditions:    All passengers over the age of 18 years must possess official documentation (i.e., COVID Passport) issued by the relevant country demonstrating that they have either been fully vaccinated against or have recovered from COVID-19, in addition to a negative result from a PCR test taken within 72 hours prior to their flight.    All passengers between the ages of 1-18 years must possess a negative result from a PCR test taken within 72 hours prior to their flight.    Authorities plan to perform periodic assessments and gradually ease entry restrictions for travelers from other locations. Returning Azerbaijani nationals require only a negative result from a PCR test taken within 72 hours prior to their flight to enter the country. For a full list of countries approved for travel and further details on requirements for entering Azerbaijan, click here.    Land and maritime borders remain closed. The only option for entry and exit is via air on a limited number of commercial and charter flights operating to and from selected destinations. "  Archive Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20211116005100/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/540751/azerbaijan-government-extends-special-quarantine-regime-through-jan-1-update-39

Current economic measures in place have been extended to December 31, 2021. The five socio-economic support measures that are extended until December 31, 2021 are as follows: Temporary unemployment due to force majeure for all sectors, The simple crisis gateway right for all sectors from a loss of 65% of turnover, A monthly bonus of 25 euros for beneficiaries of integration income, a GRAPA or an ARR Financial support for rail operators (people and freight) and Maintaining the VAT rate at 6% on hydroalcoholic gel and masks    Archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20211003171205/https://www.premier.be/fr/prolongation-ciblee-des-mesures-de-soutien-economique-jusquau-31-decembre-2021

The mask requirement now applies uniformly in all of Belgium. It is required in the following situations; in public transportation and in medical and non-medical contact occupations, stores and shopping malls; health care facilities; areas accessible to the public in companies, public buildings, court buildings; establishments for cultural, festive, sporting and recreational activities, including theaters, concert halls, cinemas, museums, indoor theme and amusement parks, indoor fitness centers and sports centers; libraries, toy and game libraries and media libraries; worship centers.     Archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20211104151557/https://www.commissioner.brussels/en/updates-covid-19/item/885-uniform-measures-in-belgium

The use of the facemask is now compulsory for all children above the age of 10, however, for education, communities decide whether or not to introduce compulsory masks for children under 12.    The use of the facemask is now required in the following circumstances: The Consultative Committee decided to generalise the wearing of masks, which will now be compulsory in the following situations:  in enclosed areas of public transport and organised collective transport;  for medical and non-medical professions;  in health care institutions;  in establishments and places where catering activities are organised;  in the context of events, both indoors and outdoors and regardless of the size of the event;  in shops and shopping centres;  in publicly accessible areas of companies, public administrations, etc;  in public buildings and courts;  in libraries, toy libraries and media libraries;  in publicly accessible areas of establishments in the cultural, festive, sports, recreational and event sectors;  in fitness centres;  in places of worship.    Archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20211127092653/https://www.commissioner.brussels/en/updates-covid-19/item/888-covid-updates-17-11

All vaccinated people are now eligible for an additional dose, considering that older people who received the vaccine earlier have been given a chance to recieve the additional dose.     A vaccination campaign for those aged 5-11 is awaiting approval by the European Medicines Agency. This vaccination will be voluntary    Archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20211127092653/https://www.commissioner.brussels/en/updates-covid-19/item/888-covid-updates-17-11

An additional dose of the vaccine is now recommended for the whole population. Following the approval recieved from the European Medicines Agency,  the Consultative Committee has asked that the Supreme Health Council and the Advisory Committee on Bioethics give their opinion on a date to start vaccinating 5- to 11-year-olds on a voluntary basis.    Archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20211127094244/https://www.info-coronavirus.be/en/news/occ-2611/

Conducting face-to-face group classes for children in language centers, educational centers and other training centers and schools is allowed while providing a physical distance of at least 1.5 m and not more than 5 people in a room, wearing protective face masks, hand hygiene, regular airing every hour and disinfection.    https://web.archive.org/web/20211025203023/https://coronavirus.bg/bg/merki/ogranichitelni-merki

Visits to Mall-type shopping centers, shops with a net retail area of ??over 300 sq m, bazaars and indoor exhibitions shall be suspended. Exceptions may be made for shops offering mainly foodstuffs, pharmacies, drugstores, opticians, pet shops, banks, postal and courier service providers, insurers, payment service providers and telecommunications operators' offices.  In all markets, marketplaces, bazaars and open-air exhibitions workers are required to wear a face mask.  Employers and recruitment bodies to organize the work process of employees in remote form (teleworking/home work), where possible, allowing the present work of a maximum of 50% of staff.  Valid through to November 30th 2021    http://web.archive.org/web/20211119164309/https://coronavirus.bg/bg/merki/ogranichitelni-merki

The holding of all mass events, such as music and other festivals, fairs, folklore initiatives and others of such nature, shall be suspended.   Visits to museums, galleries, cinemas, theaters, circus performances, concerts and other indoor performances are suspended.  http://web.archive.org/web/20211119164309/https://coronavirus.bg/bg/merki/ogranichitelni-merki

As of 1 September to 30 November 2021.  Temporary anti-epidemic measures for arrivals, according to the color zones:    Green zone - allowed on the territory of the country upon presentation of a valid EU digital COVID certificate for vaccination, disease or testing or a similar document containing the same data as the EU digital COVID certificate. In the absence of a valid EU digital COVID certificate or a similar document the person shall be quarantined for 10 days at the home or other accommodation where he has indicated that he will reside, with a prescription issued by the director of the respective regional health inspection or a deputy director authorized by him. The quarantined person may, by the end of the day following his arrival in the country, carry out a polymerase chain reaction test to detect COVID-19 or a rapid antigen test. In the event of a negative result of the examination, the quarantine of the person shall be considered terminated from the day following the registration of the result in the National Information System for Combating COVID-19.    Orange zone  - allowed on the territory of the country only upon presentation of a valid EU digital COVID certificate for vaccination, disease or testing or a similar document containing the same data as the EU digital COVID certificate. Bulgarian citizens and persons with the status of permanent, long-term or long-term residence on the territory of the Republic of Bulgaria and members of their families who do not present a document shall be quarantined for a period of 10 days. The quarantined person may, by the end of the day following his arrival in the country, carry out a polymerase chain reaction test to detect COVID-19 or a rapid antigen test as specified in. The person is considered suspended from the day following the registration of the result in the National Information System for Combating COVID-19.    Red zone - only select persons allowed on the territory upon presentation of a valid EU digital COVID certificate for vaccination or disease or similar document, simultaneously with a negative result from a polymerase chain reaction test for COVID-19, conducted up to 72 hours before entry into the country, certified by a valid EU digital COVID certificate or an analogous document containing the same data as the EU digital COVID certificate.   http://web.archive.org/web/20211119164309/https://coronavirus.bg/bg/merki/ogranichitelni-merki

Teaching during the COVID-19 pandemic can be done in several ways. The opening of schools at full capacity carries  the greatest risk of COVID-19 transmission and the emergence of hotspots, as well as widespread transmission in the  community. This risk can be reduced by implementing hygienic and epidemiological measures,    however, due to limited capacity, as well as problems in controlling the behavior of children and adolescents,  this is a challenge.    Educate staff, parents, and students about COVID-19, including symptoms, complications, how it is  transmitted, and how to prevent transmission. Get information about COVID-19 through reputable  sources such as health institutions, the World Health Organization (WHO), UNICEF. Point out false  information / myths that can circulate orally or online.  Educate all staff and students, as well as parents as much as possible, on measures to prevent the spread of  COVID-19, as well as their importance.  Update or develop school emergency plans. These plans must include responsible  persons, activities to be taken in case any of the students, staff or their  the householder becomes ill, with suspected COVID-19; as well as a specific room or area for  isolating the patient, identification of close contacts. The plan should include contact with the  local competent health institution, to whom school staff should contact in the above case, as  well as with parents.  Regardless of how classes begin, plan teaching models for students who must be in selfisolation, as well as for parents and students who belong to vulnerable groups (chronic  diseases).  Plan mental support programs and take care of the mental health of staff and students during a  pandemic.  Basic principles of prevention  Basic principles: wearing masks for students (children aged 6 to 11 should wear a mask outside  the classroom, not necessarily during classes; while older children should wear a mask during  classes), wearing masks for teaching and other staff, maintenance adequate physical distances,  maintaining hand hygiene.  Vaccination against COVID-19 teaching staff and students depending on the recommended  age for vaccination, as well as their household members, are key strategies to help schools  function at full capacity.  Students, teachers and other staff should stay home if they or any of their household  members have COVID-19-related symptoms (main symptoms are fever, cough, loss of  sense of smell / taste, malaise; other symptoms: pain, headache, conjunctivitis, diarrhea,  skin rash).  Students, teachers and other staff should stay home if they are positive for COVID-19 or in  isolation. Stay home even if they have recently been in contact with a person with COVID-19.    https://web.archive.org/web/20211120191619/https://www.zzjzfbih.ba/preporuke-covid-19/

No change in policy    https://web.archive.org/web/20211129233047/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/549896/bosnia-and-herzegovina-authorities-maintaining-covid-19-related-restrictions-nationwide-as-of-nov-26-update-34

Activities to be provided to all employees in all work environments to prevent the  transmission of COVID-19:  - Vaccination against COVID-19 employees, as well as their household members,  is a key strategy to help them function at full capacity.  - Ensure that routine cleaning and disinfection are carried out at your workplace.  Clean and disinfect traffic areas and points of contact in buildings several times a  day, such as door handles, faucets in toilets and kitchens, power switches, buttons  in elevators, and reception desks. and other contact surfaces used by a large  number of persons.  - Clean the surfaces with soap and water or detergent, after which the surfaces should  be disinfected. Sodium hypochlorite products are recommended (according to the  manufacturer's instructions), alternatively 70-90% alcohol can be used to disinfect  surfaces. Spraying surfaces alone is not enough, and can be and can potentially cause  harmful consequences.  1  Translated from Bosnian to English - www.onlinedoctranslator.com  - Meeting rooms, trainings and other areas where a large number of people gather should be  cleaned after each meeting.  - Put hand sanitizers in visible places everywhere in workplaces, especially in  public places where people have fewer opportunities to wash their hands  regularly. Ensure that these funds are regularly updated.  - For hand washing in toilets, provide warm running water and soap, as well as  disposable paper towels.  - Promote proper and regular hand washing by employees, partners and clients.    Develop a plan for a comprehensive ongoing work process in case of the spread  of COVID-19 in the local community where your business organization /  institution operates.    https://web.archive.org/web/20211120191619/https://www.zzjzfbih.ba/preporuke-covid-19/
